question: The "Galapagos Marine Reserve" is located in which country?
explanation: Galapagos Marine Reserve, a UNESCO World Heritage Site, is the largest marine reserve in a developing country and second-largest reserve in the world, is located in the Galapagos Islands under the administration of Ecuador. It is one of the largest and most biologically diverse Marine Protected Areas (MPA) in the world. This marine reserve is home to a wide range of species such as whales, dolphins, albatrosses, sharks, sea lions, penguins, fur seals, marine iguanas, sea turtles and tropical fishes.
